channel.title: [RESOLVED] Most no-ip addresses disabled by microsoft
channel.description:
In fact, microsoft seized 22 domain names operated by no-ip (can anyone find me a list)?
http://www.noip.com/blog/2014/06/30/ips-formal-statement-microsoft-takedown/ http://arstechnica.com/security/2014/06/millions-of-dymanic-dns-users-suffer-after-microsoft-seizes-no-ip-domains/
This affects us mainly because many servers on the serverstatus page use these domains, which are now offline and need to be changed asap, and the recent downtime wiped.
If you have one of these domain names on the server status page, please post a link to your server and the new domain name you'd like it pointed to on this thread and I will take care of it, including adjusting uptime.

item.title: [RESOLVED] Most no-ip addresses disabled by microsoft

@cowzownu wrote:

to: elveron.no-ip.org

Thanks a ton!

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED] Most no-ip addresses disabled by microsoft
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

EternityRS:

I feel like I’m the only one this didn’t affect… My server uses a .no-ip.org and it’s working perfectly, refreshes correctly and lets players log on. I’ve been using it since May too. What do you mean by they ‘seized’ these domains?

They took control and now own them.
Open up cmd (search cmd in windows start menu) and right click it, then run as administrator.
type:
ping no-ip.org
(then hit enter)

Edit:
It looks like no-ip.org is still owned by No-ip?

Read full topic
